sentence.idiomatic: Our house hasn't been torn down yet.
Where will you go to live after [your house] is torn down?
Those old houses will be torn down next month.
With regard to business, Christmas is definitely a great commercial opportunity.
With regard to import/export, lowering duties can boost global distribution of goods.
Generally speaking, children under one meter don't need to buy a ticket.
Which company is sponsoring the activity this time?
Korea and Japan co-hosted the 2002 World Cup.
The 2008 Olympics will be hosted by China.
Around National Day, the museum exhibited many Qing Dynasty era antiques.
This is the largest scale exhibit in our country. You can't miss it.
All the famous auto-producers from home and abroad will attend this exhibit.
This discovery has had an extremely profound influence in scientific circles.
You are thinking too deeply about this. How can one of his movement have bring such a huge change?
As he's a famous writer, even short passages of his possess profound meaning.
Recently the popularity of this pop star has dropped a lot.
Amongst these presidential candidates, who has the most popular appeal?
The shopping center thought of a lot of ways to increase its popularity.
His suggestion created high productivity in the company.
After using this new technique, our company's productivity has reached new heights.
Holding the Olympics not only brings huge economic benefits, it also can heighten society's productivity.
This exhibition is already more or less prepared.
The preparations for the Olympics are in progress.
Have the plans for that project been completed?
The living facilities in this residential area are all completed. They're very convenient.
We are in charge of every aspect of the facilities, why must you worry?
I have heard that the facilities in that building are a little old and are always breaking down.
This profession is now in great demand, so he doesn't have much stress over finding a job.
Disneyland provided this locality with a lot of employment opportunities.
It is getting more and more difficult for university students to be employed.
In the last ten years, the lives of Chinese people have improved greatly.
The passengers' difficulties in taking the bus haven't been improved yet?
The school intends to improve the students' meal conditions.
The other day, a friend asked me why Shanghai is taking the 2010 Expo so seriously. I honestly don’t know.

Actually the Expo has different meanings for different people. For example, for some common citizens it means that their old homes will be torn down for construction sites, so they will be moved into better houses. In addition, with regard to Shanghai city itself, the most meaningful thing is that it will stimulate economic development.
But I still don’t understand. Isn’t the Expo just an international exhibition?

Simply put, yes it is. However, the Expo is hosted by the government. It is a large-scale comprehensive exhibition attended by many different countries and international organizations. The difference between this and other exhibits is that it presents achievements in social, economic, cultural, scientific and technological fields. Its special features are the long duration, the scale of the event, and the many countries that participate. The effects are extremely far-reaching.
Oh! It's almost like a cultural Olympics. We will be able to see exhibits and activities originating from different countries and various fields. The content will definitely not be lacking.

Exactly. This is another reason why the Expo is able to bring so many benefits to the economy and reputation of the host country. Actually the preparations for the Expo have already started. Many facilities related to the Expo are already under construction. This has already brought the community a lot of employment opportunities, and has also improved our living environment.
Oh, no wonder everyone gets so excited when they talk about the Expo. Oh, isn’t there always a theme for every Expo?
You’re right. This time it is “cities makes life better*”. When the time comes, I hope there will be a lot of new ideas on how to make our lives better.

word.literal: to pull down (an old house) and move its occupants elsewhere
